Description of incident: Lime Crime, an online cosmetics company notified customers of an unauthorized access to their website server which resulted in malware being installed. This malware allowed customer data to be captured, including credit card payment information. The information compromised included names, addresses, card account numbers, expiration dates, security codes and Lime Crime website usernames and passwords. The malware affected customers who purchased items on the website from October 4, 2014 through February 15, 2015. For those customers that used PayPal to purchase items, their Lime Crime website usernames and passwords may have also been compromised. More Information: http://www.scmagazine.com/malware-on-lime-crime-website-payment-cards-co...
